alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Johnston; Nash; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 7:47AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with gusty winds and torrential downpours will impact portions of southwestern Nash, east central Wake, north central Johnston and southeastern Franklin Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 745 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zebulon, or 15 miles north of Smithfield, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Nashville, Zebulon, Bailey, Bunn, Wendell, Spring Hope, Middlesex, Castalia, Pilot and Emit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall of one half to one inch of rain in fifteen to thirty minutes is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
